faqs.question: Is Marisa a vegetarian?
faqs.answer: No, she eats pretty much any land animal and also fish. Have no fear about throwing some meat on the BBQ, or in a stir-fry.

faqs.question: You said she is allergic to some vegetables, are cooked vegetables fine?
faqs.answer: Yup, totally. Steamed, roasted, in a stir-fry, or on the BBQ. Cooked veggies are a safe bet unless listed above.

faqs.question: Salads are raw, should I avoid making one?
faqs.answer: Salads are usually a safe bet. Despite the allergy to certain raw vegetables, lettuce/tomatoes/cucumbers/onions are ok. Bonus points if you have a garlic dressing.

faqs.question: Does rice have gluten?
faqs.answer: Nope! Marisa thoroughly enjoys basmati or wild rice.

faqs.question: Can Marisa eat cheese?
faqs.answer: Yes. Use all the cheese you want. The more the better.

faqs.question: Is it rude if I want to serve some shellfish/peanut dish for supper?
faqs.answer: No problem! Just let us know and we will happily bring something safe to cook up for Marisa.

faqs.question: Marisa is allergic to shellfish but I've seen her eat oysters/mussels/clams.
faqs.answer: Despite the shell, clams, oysters, scallops, and mussels are all mollusks. Totally safe.

faqs.question: Does all the food I am serving have to be organic/locally grown?
faqs.answer: Absolutely not. We definitely do not expect anyone to buy organic food on our behalf. That said, it's always great to support your local farmers' market.
